page.title: 14PRESTON'S UNIQUE CLASSROOM
page.content: Children at Kennington County Primary School start their education in a classroom which is the only one of its type in the world. Erected in 1974 the ICOSAHEDRON is made of fire- proof material. Because of its shape it is nick-named the 'Bubble'. It has 20 sides, each made up of 3 equilateral triangles. The windows are all along the bottom but don't open. The air conditioning keeps it from being too hot or cold. The outside is unpainted and needs no maintenance. The inside cannot be spoilt by vandalism. At present there are 35 children, a teacher and a nursery assistant. The children learn to read and write, enjoy painting, watch T.V. programmes and practise plays for the school. The children love being in the 'Bubble' with it's feeling of space and safety.
